gurmukhi: su ibcwr hY Bt eyk ]gun bIc jws Anyk ]sMjog hY iek Aaur ]ijin jIiq Awpiq gaur ]34]261]
transliteration: Su Bichaar Hai Bhat Ek|| Goun Beech Jaas Anek|| Sanjog Hai Ik Aur|| Jin(i) Jeet(i) Aapat(i) Gaddd||34||261||
translation: There is a warrior named Suvichar (good thought), who has many qualities; there is another warriors named Sanjog (coherence), who had even conquered Shiva.34.261.

gurmukhi: iek hom nwm su bIr ]Air kIn jws ADIr ]pUjw su Aaur bKwn ]ijh so n paurKu Awn ]35]262]
transliteration: Ik Hom Naam Su Beer|| Ar(i) Keen Jaas Adheer|| Poojaa Su Aur Bakhaan|| Jih So Na Paurakh(u) Aan||35||362||
translation: There is one warrior named Hom (sacrifice), who has made the enemies impatient; another one is Pooja (worship), who is unequalled in courage by anyone.35.262.

gurmukhi: Anurkqqw iek Aaur ]sB suBt ko isrmaur ]byrkqqw iek Awn ]ijh sO n Awn pRDwn ]36]263]
transliteration: Anuraktataa Ik Aur|| Sabh Soubhat Ko Sirmaur|| Beraktataa Ik Aan|| Jih Sau Na Aan Pradhaan||36||263||
translation: The chief of all the warriors is Anuraktita; in the same way, there is none like Virakt (unattached).36.263.

gurmukhi: sqsMg Aaur subwh ]ijh dyK ju`D auCwh ]Bt nyh nwm Apwr ]bl jaun ko ibkrwr ]37]264]
transliteration: Satsan Aur Soubaah|| Jih Dekh Juddh Ouchhaad|| Bhat Neh Naam Apaar|| Bal Jaoun Ko Bikraar||37||264||
translation: Seeing Satsang (good company) and Bal (power), the enthusiasm for fighting is increased and in the same way, the warrior named Saneh (love) is terribly powerful.37.264.

gurmukhi: iek pRIiq Aru hir Bgiq ]ijh joq jgmg jgq ]Bt d`q m`q mhwn ]sB Taur mY prDwn ]38]265]
transliteration: Ik Prit(i) Ar(u) Har(i) Bhagad(i)|| Jih Jot Jagmag Jagad|| Bhat Datt Matt Mahaan|| Sabh Thaur Mai Pardhaan||38||265||
translation: There are also Har-Bhakti (devotion with the Lord) and Preet (love) with whose light, the whole world is enlightened; the path of Yoga of Dutt is also superb and is considered superior at all the places.38.265.

gurmukhi: iek kRu`D Aaur pRbod ]rx dyK kY ijh kRoD ]ieh BwNq sYn bnwie ]duhu idis inswx bjwie ]39]266]
transliteration: Ik Kruddh Aur Prabodh|| Ran Dekh Kai Jih Krodh|| Eh Bhaantsain Banaae|| Duh(u) Dis(i) Nisaan Bajaae||39||266||
translation: Seeing the war, Krodh (anger) and Prabodh (knowledge), in their fury, souding their trumpets, marched for attack after decorating their forces.39.266.

gurmukhi: ieh ibiD sYn bnwie kY cVy inswn bjwie ]ijh ijh ibiD Awhv mcXo so so khq sunwie ]40]267]
transliteration: Eh Bidh(i) Sain Banaae Kai Chaaae Nisaan Bajaae|| Jih Jih Bidh(i) Aahav Machyo So So Kahat Sounaae||40||267||
translation: In this way, arranging their forces and sounding their trumpets, the attack was made; the way, in which the war was fought, it presents its description.40.267.

gurmukhi: ik sMbwh au`TyN ]ik swvMq ju`tyN ]ik inswx hu`ky ]ik bwjMqR Du`ky ]41]268]
transliteration: Ki Sanbaah Outthen|| Ki Saavant Joutten|| Ki Nisaan Houkke|| Ki Baajantra Dhoukke||41||268||
translation: The arms arose, the warriors fought; the trumpets and other musical instruments were played.41.268.

gurmukhi: ik bMbwl nyjy ]ik jMj√çwl qyjy ]ik swvMq FUkY ]ik hw hwie kUky ]42]269]
transliteration: Ki Banbaal Neje|| Ki Janjvaal Teje|| Ki Saavant Dhoukai|| Ki Haa Haae Kooke||42||269||
translation: The lances with tassels were lustrous like fire-flames; the warriors taking them began to fight with one another and there was lamentation.42.269.

gurmukhi: ik isMDUr g`jy ]ik qMdUr b`jy ]ik sMbwh ju`ty ]ik sMnwh Pu`ty ]43]270]
transliteration: Ki Sindhoor Gadje|| Ki Tandoor Bajje|| Ki Sanbaah Joutte|| Ki Sannaah Phoutte||43||270||
translation: The elephants trumpetted, the musical instruments were played;; the warriors fought and the armours werr torn.43.270.

gurmukhi: ik fwkMq faurU ]ik BRwmMq BaurU ]ik AwhwV if`gy ]ik rwkqR iB`gy ]44]271]
transliteration: Ki Daakant Dauroo|| Ki Bhraamannd Bhauroo|| Ki Aahaad Digge|| Ki Raaktra Bhiggad||44||271||
translation: The tabors were played; the Bhairavas wandered in the battlefield; and the warriors saturated with blood fell in the fighting.44.271.

gurmukhi: ik cwmuMf crmM ]ik swvMq DrmM ]ik AwvMq ju`DM ]ik swn`D b`DM ]45]272]
transliteration: Ki Chaamounnd Charman|| Ki Saavant Dharman|| Ki Aavant Juddhan|| Ki Saanaadhh Baddhan||45||272||
translation: Decorated with arms and weapons, the warriors like Chamuda came to the war-arena.45.272.
